meanings.definition: To treat someone in a cruel or violent way.
meanings.sent1: The bully would brutalize the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: It is never okay to brutalize another person, no matter the circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The villain in the movie loved to brutalize the hero, but justice prevailed in the end.
meanings.sent4: The harsh reality of war can brutalize even the most compassionate souls.
meanings.sent5: The images of the war zone will forever brutalize my memories.

meanings.definition: To make something harsh or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The bitter cold wind seemed to brutalize the delicate flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The negative comments online can brutalize a person's self-esteem.
meanings.sent3: The spicy chili had the power to brutalize anyone's taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise pollution can brutalize the peaceful atmosphere of a small town.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat of the desert sun can brutalize unprotected skin.

meanings.sent1: When survival is at stake, even the gentlest creatures can brutalize each other.
meanings.sent2: The once peaceful tribe started to brutalize their enemies after years of conflict.
meanings.sent3: The cute little puppy can sometimes brutalize its favorite stuffed toy during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The hunger for power can brutalize the noblest intentions of a leader.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the night seemed to brutalize the sounds of the forest.
